page.title: 09Abbey Farm 1985
page.content: The farm is{105 hectares}with about 30 hectares of arable land and the remainder producing grass or forage crops for the dairy herd.There are over{90 Fresian cows}producing an average{6750 l.}containing{3.80% {butterfat}.Ideally every cow produces a calf annually with the majority born during Aug,Sept and Oct.The calves are all reard until eight months when the males and surplus females are sold.The cows are milked through a herring bone parlour twice daily by one man.The milk is stored in a 2200 l.stainless refrigerated tank.The milk is collected daily by a 10,000 l.tanker and taken to King's Lynn where the milk is processed and bottled,then distributed to the consumer. Diet.Winter_concentrate,beettops,kale, straw,hay,silage. Summer_grass.
